question: In golf, what happens if you swing at the ball and miss, commonly known as an 'air shot'?*

choices.text: It counts as a stroke, and you play the ball from where it lies.
You can re-try without penalty since the ball was not struck.
If the ball moves but stays within the teeing area marked by the tee markers you can tee the ball back up before hitting it again
You can replace the ball on a tee without counting the miss as a stroke.

explanation: In golf, an 'air shot' (a swing and miss) is counted as a stroke. When you make a stroke and miss the ball, it counts as one stroke under the rules of golf.
